update.description:
* Added option to import a floor plan to draw on top of (issue #422)

* Includes tool to help users scale the image (pixels to real world measures)

* Possible to import a different image for each level of the building

* `View` button to toggle visibility of the `Floorplan` or the `Features`

* Fixed bugs with adding/deleting levels and added `-` button (issue  #361 ?)

content.raw:
Yes I was trying the same trick. It works when an outside event triggers it, but I didn't manage to make it work when the currently checked button is re-checked. Doing the trick on `buttonPress`, `buttonRelease` or `click`, I either end up with the button never being checked, or always being checked, I think it's because the `QButtonGroup` is firing its own events.

Tried also creating a hidden button to check when I want everything else unchecked and had the same problem.

I thought of adding some variable to keep track of the current mode and see when the same mode has been selected, or something like that.

Or maybe going back to the approach I have on commits 7d2a1d9 and 9bcf9a7 - firing events back and forth...
content.html:
Yes I was trying the same trick. It works when an outside event triggers it, but I didn't manage to make it work when the currently checked button is re-checked. Doing the trick on buttonPress, buttonRelease or click, I either end up with the button never being checked, or always being checked, I think it's because the QButtonGroup is firing its own events.

Tried also creating a hidden button to check when I want everything else unchecked and had the same problem.

I thought of adding some variable to keep track of the current mode and see when the same mode has been selected, or something like that.

Or maybe going back to the approach I have on commits 7d2a1d9 and 9bcf9a7 - firing events back and forth...

content.raw:
QButtonGroup does almost what I wanted - it prevents all buttons to be selected at the same time, but it requires a button to be selected at all times, so the brushes can't easily be toggled. 

I'll revert this change and handle the button toggling issue on a separate pull request (there are some related bugs when cancelling the current draw mode as well).
content.html:
QButtonGroup does almost what I wanted - it prevents all buttons to be selected at the same time, but it requires a button to be selected at all times, so the brushes can't easily be toggled.

I'll revert this change and handle the button toggling issue on a separate pull request (there are some related bugs when cancelling the current draw mode as well).

pullrequest.title: Building editor: Import background image and improve add/delete levels

content.raw:
Select `Add Wall`, then `Add Window`. Without this check, both will be highlighted, because `_type` is not empty (`_type == "window"`)

This checks that `_type` is the same as the pressed button by checking that `indow` (window without the first character, which is capitalized in the button) is contained in the button text (`Add Window`), so all other brushes must be unchecked.

There are still several problems changing from one mode to the other though, which I've *hopefully* solved on another branch  (commits [7d2a1d9](https://bitbucket.org/chapulina/gazebo/commits/7d2a1d91ba46813bddde54667c83201b5ee553e3) and [9bcf9a7](https://bitbucket.org/chapulina/gazebo/commits/9bcf9a7320f1b6ee850f3f5d7fb4d27a966c4fcc) )
content.html:
Select Add Wall, then Add Window. Without this check, both will be highlighted, because _type is not empty (_type == "window")

This checks that _type is the same as the pressed button by checking that indow (window without the first character, which is capitalized in the button) is contained in the button text (Add Window), so all other brushes must be unchecked.

There are still several problems changing from one mode to the other though, which I've hopefully solved on another branch (commits 7d2a1d9 and 9bcf9a7 )

pull_request.title: Building editor: Import background image and improve add/delete levels

pullrequest.title: Building editor: Import background image and improve add/delete levels

content.raw:
Current defaults:

### Wall ###
**Thickness**: 0.2 m ~ 7.9 in

**Height**: 2.5 m ~ 98.4 in

*(Windows and doors are only holes on the wall, so they don't have thickness)*
### Window ###
**Width**: 0.8 m ~ 31.5 in

**Height**: 0.8 m ~ 31.5 in

**Elevation**: 0.5 m ~ 19.7 in (distance from base of window to floor, I think it looks very low right now)

### Door ###
**Width**: 1.0 m ~ 39.4 in

**Height**: 2.0 m ~ 78.7 in

**Elevation**: 0.0 m ~ 0.0 in

### Stairs ###
**Width**: 1.0 m ~ 39.4 in

**Depth**: 3.5 m ~ 137.8 in

**Height**: wall height

**Steps**: 15 (step height: 0.17 m ~ 6.6 in)
content.html:
Current defaults:

Wall

Thickness: 0.2 m ~ 7.9 in

Height: 2.5 m ~ 98.4 in

(Windows and doors are only holes on the wall, so they don't have thickness)

Window

Width: 0.8 m ~ 31.5 in

Height: 0.8 m ~ 31.5 in

Elevation: 0.5 m ~ 19.7 in (distance from base of window to floor, I think it looks very low right now)

Door

Width: 1.0 m ~ 39.4 in

Height: 2.0 m ~ 78.7 in

Elevation: 0.0 m ~ 0.0 in

Stairs

Width: 1.0 m ~ 39.4 in

Depth: 3.5 m ~ 137.8 in

Height: wall height

Steps: 15 (step height: 0.17 m ~ 6.6 in)
